chief_complaint: Patient presents with intermittent episodes of substernal chest discomfort associated with physical exertion.

symptoms.pain_characteristics: No radiation of pain, diaphoresis, or associated autonomic symptoms. No episodes of rest angina or crescendo pattern.

cardiovascular.rate_and_rhythm: Regular rate and rhythm, S1 and S2 normal, no S3 or S4 gallop
cardiovascular.murmur: Grade II/VI systolic ejection murmur at right upper sternal border

respiratory.auscultation: Clear to auscultation bilaterally, no wheezes or rales

neurological.status: Alert and oriented x3, no focal deficits

exercise_stress_test.findings: Reversible perfusion defect in the anterolateral wall, suggestive of inducible ischemia

assessment.cause: Secondary to known coronary artery disease
assessment.additional_findings: Evidence of inducible ischemia on stress testing

medications: Continue Aspirin 81mg daily for antiplatelet prophylaxis
Continue Metoprolol 25mg BID for rate control
PRN Nitroglycerin 0.4mg sublingual for acute anginal episodes

procedures.purpose: To evaluate coronary anatomy and assess for potential revascularization candidates

lifestyle_modifications: Enrollment in cardiac rehabilitation program recommended
follow_up: Return to clinic in 2 weeks post-angiography

educational_points: Patient educated on: Recognition of unstable anginal symptoms requiring immediate medical attention
Proper technique for sublingual nitroglycerin administration
